title: Parametric Rates of Change - direction with reason

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="t greater than 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals negative e to the power of t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi></msup></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals ln t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The particle is always moving to the right and down because <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is negative and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is positive.

The particle is always moving to the right and down because <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is decreasing and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is increasing.

The particle is always moving to the left and up because <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is negative and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is positive.

The particle is always moving to the left and up because <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is decreasing and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is increasing.
